The Strategic Relationship Marketing program is a capstone project-based program offered in the School of Marketing at George Brown College. The minimum computing requirements are a PC with Intel i3 processor, Microsoft Windows 7 or higher with 4GB RAM, web camera and microphone, Wi-Fi compatibility, and Microsoft Office for Windows. For Apple/Mac users, the requirements are an Intel i3 processor, macOS High Sierra with 4GB RAM, web camera and microphone, Wi-Fi compatibility, and Office 2016 for Mac. The program requires students to complete a one-semester work experience, either co-op or internship, after the second academic semester. Students can apply for work experience opportunities provided by George Brown College and employers, or pursue self-directed industry opportunities. George Brown Marketing students have access to membership in the Canadian Marketing Association (CMA) as part of their tuition fees. The CMA membership includes various benefits such as networking opportunities, access to marketing research, and publications.

The tuition fees of the college include memberships in the Canadian Marketing Association (CMA) and Interactive Advertising Bureau (IAB). CMA membership provides access to live and online events, professional development opportunities, tools, resources, networking opportunities, and exclusive access to CMA NXT. IAB membership offers student volunteer opportunities for marquee events, members only webinars and podcasts, original Canadian digital marketing research, globally accepted digital ad standards, and globally standardized courses, certification, and custom workshops.

Graduates of the college's program will be prepared for careers in various customer-centric sectors, such as hospitality, telecommunications and media, not-for-profit, retail, financial services, digital agencies, and advertising agencies. Potential positions may include marketing coordinator, CRM data analyst, automated campaign specialist, CRM marketing specialist, market research analyst, loyalty marketing coordinator, lead generation specialist, customer experience specialist, business analyst, and sales enablement specialist.

To graduate from the B409 program, students need to complete 13 mandatory courses, one work experience term (which can be co-op, internship, simulation, consulting, or research projects), and a pre-requisite of COMP 1192 – Computer Applications for Database Marketing. The first semester includes the following courses: COMP 1192 - Computer Applications for Database Marketing, MARK 1027 - Marketing Management, MARK 4005 - Applied Business Communications, and MARK 4013 - Customer Experience Fundamentals.

Domestic students should apply through Ontario Colleges. ( Application method for domestic students)
International students should apply through the George Brown College Online Application System. ( Application method for international students)
On-campus information sessions are held on a regular basis. ( Information sessions availability)
For inquiries about domestic admission requirements, admission deadlines, or the admissions process, contact the Admissions Office at admissions@georgebrown.ca or visit the Admissions section. ( Contact information for domestic student admissions)
For inquiries about OSAP, Bursaries, Scholarships and other financial inquiries, contact the Financial Aid Office at FinAid@georgebrown.ca or visit the Financial Aid section. ( Contact information for financial aid)
Make an appointment to see an Entry Advisor for advice on program options and which program might be best suited for you. (Entry advising service availability)
Contact Anne Iarocci or John Peco for inquiries related to the Centre for Business programs. ( Contact information for Centre for Business inquiries)
Visit the International Contact Us page to contact international recruitment representatives specializing by country of origin. ( Contact information for international students)

Contact Anne Iarocci or John Peco for inquiries related to the Centre for Business programs. ( Contact information for Centre for Business inquiries)
Visit the International Contact Us page to contact international recruitment representatives specializing by country of origin. ( Contact information for international students)

The program "Strategic Relationship Marketing" is offered at George Brown College's School of Marketing. Classes usually take place at the St. James Campus, specifically at 200 King St. E. and 290 Adelaide St. E., Toronto, Ontario, Canada. Campus tours can be booked regularly, and virtual tours are available. Related programs include Marketing Management – Digital Media (Postgraduate) (B433), Marketing Management – Financial Services (Postgraduate) (B406), and International Business Management (Postgraduate) (B411). Riddhi Modi, an Ontario College graduate certificate student, shared her experience of pursuing the program and recognizing her potential at George Brown College. The college offers on-campus and off-campus opportunities for students to develop industry relationships. Prospective applicants can book a campus tour, sign up for tailored resources, and learn more about programs and life at George Brown College by providing their first name, last name, email address, and indicating whether they are domestic or international students.
